storyInfo: The night fades. The dawn prepares to break. The abbot is ready.

attributes.content: There you are, Father.
attributes.name: Gaunt Monastery Inhabitant

attributes.content: It's your turn to clean the chapel today, Jori?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Gratias.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Just doing my job. I had trouble sleeping anyway.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: I'll fetch the sacramental bread.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: No, no need.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Oh, right, look at me, dust all over my hands.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: Say, do you smell something...? It's pretty faint...
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: A strange smell?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: No, a pleasant one. It's fresh. I sense in it... vitality.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: It's hard to put into words. It's like standard downwind. I don't know where it comes from, but I feel like I'd get somewhere if I followed it.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: I think it's the smell of flowers, Jori.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We don't have enough flour, so flower powder was added to the sacramental bread.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The few remaining bottles of wine in the cellar have started to go sour, so I also added some flower powder to those too.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Clément harvested some flowers a couple of years ago, grinding them into powder and storing it in the cellar...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: He loves the flowers, just as he loves us.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: This will be the final communion we take before the abbey departs. We are short on food, however, so we must reduce each share of sacramental bread, even mixing in... other grains.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Please don't say that. I'm very much looking forward to today's communion...
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: Then go and wash your face. Come back with the others when it's time for Matins.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I'll do the rest myself.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Yes, Father.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: Will we be saved after today, Father?
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: All of us, Sankta and Sarkaz... will we all be saved?
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: Even though Gerald is already...
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: Go, Jori.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: O-Okay, see you later, Father.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: The old man closes the door.
He climbs the chancel slowly.
Stefano Torregrossa, the aging abbot of Sanctilaminium Ambrosii, carefully divides the sacramental bread and wine.
His head is bowed. It is still early. The dim morning light shines through the windows behind the holy statue. The face of the statue is hidden in darkness, as is the abbot's own.
Yes. We will all be saved.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: She walks into the broken sacrarium, crushing the charred remains of plants to powder beneath her feet.
The arched roof of the sacrarium has collapsed in the fire, exposing the interior in the sunlight.
The wind has carried away the smell, but there is no one to clean up the rubble.
The marks of the fire will remain forever, unless the chapel is rebuilt.
She takes a look at the collapsed statue, then abruptly turns to the empty space behind her.
Humans struggle, punish and forgive themselves, like a sonata at its climax, the keys dancing a frantic tune.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When a decision is made, the long and steady coda begins, the emptiness at the end of catharsis, yet infinitely determined.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Emotions are complex, but the changes are always alike. The melody is conventional, regular, devoid of surprise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I sense your serenity. You have made your choice.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: In any case, the song I should play is you. Hear the voice of your own heart, here at the very end.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You lost, vibrant soul.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: All the pots and chopping boards... signs of baking, but no smell of yeast in the air... oh, I guess it's unleavened bread.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: This looks like they were preparing the Eucharist here.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: There is unidentified debris... it feels wet. Is it because we're underground?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: There is flour left in the corner... why is it so damp and sticky?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: This smell...
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Is this the only path the pious abbot saw, at the end of it all?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Can't get in touch with Federico... tell Oren? That will only make things more complicated.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Am I the one who's going to have to do this? I barely know where Iberia even is.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: This is such a headache.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: My forces will soon surround the monastery...
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: I will command them to block every path in and out. You stay here and coordinate with the assault.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Are you sure you want to do this, Oren?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Did you go over to Lemuen's side the moment you saw her? I don't think I need to waste my time explaining this again.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: But I'll stop you, Oren.
Lemuen?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Ugh. She caught up.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Buy time while I rendezvous with the troops.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: No way. Do you see the expression on her face?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: I'm not getting on her bad side. I still remember when she dragged me out of school and confiscated my drone. I never saw it again.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Gratias, Serpilia.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You never thought to convince the abbot to bring the monastery back to Laterano.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: That's your job.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You never intended to let any of the Sarkaz leave, you've even got commandos deployed to carry out your plan.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Fifty men... the limit of what I can muster.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: What are the Lateran laws to you, Oren?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I will submit myself to His Holiness's judgment when we get back... though I don't think I've done anything that should be punished.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You know the consequences of an assault on the abbey.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The people here, both Sankta and Sarkaz, are like travelers who lost their way in the wilderness, who found warmth by a campfire.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The campfire guides their kin to rescue them, and other poor wandering souls.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: They have no one to count on. They are weak and frightened. But they still hold on to their precious kindness.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: That's why Gerald gave his life to plead with us, and ordered the Sarkaz under his leadership to keep the peace between the two sides.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: But what if the campfire has attracted some beasts?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I wish I could say pretty words and do the kind of work everyone admires, Cardinal Aide Lemuen.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: But I can't. You've never traveled the war-torn wastes with thousands upon thousands of refugees, seen the dark cloud that blankets the skies over Londinium.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: But I thought you would at least have a tacit understanding with me, give some thought to the danger in letting those Sarkaz go.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: The atrocities the Sarkaz committed in Victoria are well-known. They continue to spread their terror across the lands.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: If you truly believe in His Holiness's plan, believe in the value of the Legati, then you should understand why Laterano can't be merciful here.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: The friendship that Laterano built at the Summit of Nations is more fragile than the paper windows of this corridor.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: The Sarkaz in the abbey are resentful, and affected by Arturia's Arts. There's no telling what lengths they will go to in order to get revenge after they leave.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Plus, what would happen if word got out that a Lateran nomadic abbey has been colluding with the Sarkaz for decades?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: How will Laterano uphold its sanctity among the nations of Terra? How will she maintain her already-fragile diplomatic ties?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: What will the Holy City look like when the fires of war burn?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Fifty men. That's all will take to resolve the situation here, and bury it all in darkness.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: These Sarkaz are hunters, farmers... the only mercenary is dead. We saw proof with our own eyes.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You're planning a massacre.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You talk about upholding Laterano's sanctity, when you're the one defiling it. Don't you see the hypocrisy in that?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You're the hypocrite here, Lemuen.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: The 'Lemuen the Silent' I know wouldn't have blinked at something like this.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Did five years asleep change you?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Or was it the so-called 'Martyr'—
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Oren never managed to say the name.

The wheelchair closes the distance in the blink of an eye, and his midsection meets the barrel of a sniper rifle. Leaning against the wall, he barely manages to stay on his feet, and it takes all his effort to keep his voice level.
Gah—
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Go on.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: ...Lemuen the Silent.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: I told you not to get on her bad side.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: Team Two at target location. Charges set.
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: All three exits on the blueprints of Sanctilaminium Ambrosii are under control.
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: If anyone tries to get out, the explosion will collapse the passage and force them back...
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: More like bury them under the rubble. Team Two was laughing about not being too precise here.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Teams Three and Four have taken the high ground. We have sniper cover in all directions.
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: All teams in position.
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Right on time.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Reverend Oren, we are in position to begin the assault on the Sarkaz in the abbey.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Repeat: We are in position.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: No response.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: ...That's not good.
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Ha, don't worry about it. He probably has his hands full with an extra-large crepe.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Does that happen a lot?
attributes.name: Young Lateran Commando

attributes.content: All the time. First time on a special operation? Chill. The Lateran watches over you.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: Just make sure you're ready. We'll go in the front door if we can't reach Oren, or if there's any unusual activity.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando

attributes.content: No one in the hallway. Quick, this way.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: That way leads out the abbey. Aren't we looking for Gerald?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: No, I need to get you to safety first.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Didn't you hear? The Laterans are taking the abbey by force. That woman, Serpilia, might have played nice, but the army won't.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: You can't be seen by the Lateran army. You're fallen. To them, you're evi...
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Go ahead, Raimund. I can handle it.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Don't... don't let me interrupt you, I did Fina.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: All I meant to say is that you've never changed, not to me, Fortuna.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Anyway, you're in the same boat we are. It's only going to mean more trouble for the others if you stay behind.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: I'll do as you say.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: But what about you, Raimund? Will you be alright?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Don't worry, Gerald made plans for everything. I'm sure he anticipated something like this.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: I'll come back and help him once I've found a safe place for you.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Your palms are sweating, Raimund. What's going on?
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Nothing, just... a feeling I can't describe, like a heavy weight...
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Maybe it's just that I didn't eat breakfast.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: If not for all this, we would be having communion right now, with Gerald and everyone else...
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: We'll have plenty of chances.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: Take a deep breath, Raimund. I'll be the one pulling you along now.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: This way. The rooms here are all empty. No one will see us.
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: I'm fine. We're almost to the front door.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: The Laterans might hear us opening the door. We go right as soon as we're outside. The rocks and tall grass should provide cover.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Are you ready? I pulled the latch.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Th-This is...
attributes.name: Fortuna

attributes.content: So that's why I had a feeling. Lateran troops.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Stay behind me, Fortuna.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: ...Team One here. Sarkaz sighted at the front door.
attributes.name: Veteran Lateran Commando
